meanings.definition: Feeling or showing strong displeasure or hostility
meanings.sent1: She was very angry when her toy broke.
meanings.sent2: The teacher looked angry when the students were too loud.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave an angry meow when it saw the dog.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, looking angry in the sky.
meanings.sent5: His face turned red with angry frustration.

meanings.sent1: He was so angry that he slammed the door.
meanings.sent2: The bull's eyes were angry before it charged.
meanings.sent3: The angry toddler threw his toys in a tantrum.
meanings.sent4: The engine made an angry growling noise.
meanings.sent5: Her voice was sharp and angry as she scolded him.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or resulting from anger
meanings.sent1: The argument grew more and more angry as voices rose.
meanings.sent2: The letter was written in an angry tone.
meanings.sent3: The angry driver honked loudly in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The angry sea crashed against the rocks.
meanings.sent5: His eyes flashed with angry determination.
